coding_practice.title: Wiggle Sort II
coding_practice.description:
Given an integer array nums, reorder it such that nums[0] < nums[1] > nums[2] < nums[3]....

You may assume the input array always has a valid answer.
coding_practice.constraints:
1 <= nums.length <= 5 * 10^4
0 <= nums[i] <= 5000
It is guaranteed that there will be an answer for the given input nums.
coding_practice.follow up: Can you do it in O(n) time and/or in-place with O(1) extra space?
coding_practice.solution:
class Solution:
    def wiggleSort(self, nums):
        nums.sort()
        n = len(nums)
        half = (n + 1) // 2
        left = nums[:half][::-1]
        right = nums[half:][::-1]
        nums[::2] = left
        nums[1::2] = right
coding_practice.explanation:
1. 先將 nums 排序。
2. 將前半部分反轉作為 left，後半部分反轉作為 right。
3. 將 left 放到偶數索引，right 放到奇數索引。
4. 這樣能保證 nums[0] < nums[1] > nums[2] < nums[3] 的交錯順序。
